page.title: 15SCOUTS CAMP (1)
page.content: Following a spell of fine weather in February the Scout Leaders decided to hold a weekend camp at Primrose Hill, Scawby. The objective was for the Scouts to practice their basic camping skills. Thirteen Scouts accompanied two Leaders on a dry Saturday morning and very soon after arrival tents were pitched and lunch was prepared. After lunch the Scouts were instructed in certain basic survival skills and little did we know of what was to come! Some two hours later, as fires were being prepared for the main cooked meal of the day, it started snowing, a flurry at first but soon a blizzard. Meals were completed and much fun was had in the deepening snow. However, everybody became wet, cold and following a vote, we went to bed.
